title: 2.0.1 setup issues tax calculation shipping h2database persistence xml
description: PersistableCustomerPopulator.java - state was not populated for Billing and Delivery so tax calculation was throw null pointer exception if tax calculation option is set to either shipping of billing address. I am using it in Singapore so zone is empty. If store address is used for tax calculation then it works as zone is present in prepopulated data. Again stateprovince is empty for store too. I am not sure if zone concept is new and there will be maintenance screens developed in admin to populate zones.? TaxServiceImpl.java - comparison with enum SHIPPINGADDRESS, BILLINGADDRESS, STOREADDRESS is not working as STOREADDRESS.name() is not used while doing equals comparison. - if(taxBasisCalculation.name().equals(TaxBasisCalculation.SHIPPINGADDRESS)){ - if(taxBasisCalculation.name().equals(TaxBasisCalculation.SHIPPINGADDRESS.name({ sm-shop/src/main/java/com/salesmanager/web/utils/LocaleUtils.java - gives MissingResourceException while fetching getISO3Country(). Just wrap the exception in try catch and ignore the exception. sm-shop/src/main/resources/log4j.xml - org.apache.log4j.rolling.RollingFileAppender should be changed to org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender. shopizer-properties.xml - I would suggest to keep prepopulate data on as default as it will help a lot of people to evaluate the product. Just like I was doing. sm-shop/src/main/webapp/pages/shop/templates/bootstrap3/sections/header.jsp - missing taglib inclusion for sm:storeLogo/. Tax, Shipping configuration needs to be done in prepopulated data to run smoothly. H2database - orderBy with language was giving errors saying order by column should be part of select columns, but in mysql it seems to be working. I had to remove all the orderBy language.id portion to make it work. http://www.h2database.com/javadoc/org/h2/constant/ErrorCode.html#c90068 shipping option - while submitting as guest shipping option was coming as null, and this was giving a lot of problems. sm-core/src/main/resources/META-INF/sm-persistence.xml - missing entry - <class>com.salesmanager.core.business.payments.model.Transaction</class> I am not creating multiple issue requests as I believe these are basic and might have been already fixed. functionality - after order fulfillment I couldn't find the remaining quantity available getting reduced to reflect the number of items delivered. Overall I liked the application but its a bit limited in inventory management and order fulfillment.
patched_file_types: source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | config-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file

title: Ability to create Permission group using configuration
description: Currently Shopizer is creating Predefined Permission through `InitializationLoader.java` class by creating new Permission object and creating it though `permissionService`. User should have ability to create new permission instance through configuration. 1.All Permission should be defined in a property file or `XML` file. 2. Ability to read this file and create permission on server initialization
patched_file_types: source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | data-file | data-file

title: Shopizer-oracle : Getting 404 while on-click event of newly created category
description: In Oracle setup, Once we add the category from shopizer admin it is available on shopizer web portal. But when we surf the added category for the products available within it at that time we are getting error page. Please find attached back-end logs and the screen shot of shopizer web portal. Below is the query which is getting failed, when added category is clicked. Error Query (Bind Index parameter value (:CID = 1) select categories, count(product.id) from Product product inner join product.categories categories where categories.id in (:cid) and product.available=true and product.dateAvailable<=:dt group by categories.id  ![shopizer-error-page](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68943661/98813015-8b1bce80-2449-11eb-8218-208d048f3b00.png) [backend-error.log](https://github.com/shopizer-ecommerce/shopizer/files/5524009/backend-error.log)
patched_file_types: config-file | source-file | source-file | test-file | other-file | source-file

title: Build Failure for ProductTest class
description: Hi Team, I have facing this issue since long. This issue is an assertion failed in my machine. I have debugged more and found the error in ProductTest.java class in sm-core. In the method `private void testAttributes(Product product) throws Exception {} ` it shows the error at below line. ` Assert.assertEquals(new Long(attributes.size()).longValue(), 3l);` Step to reproduce in windows machine - [ ] git clone shopizer - [ ] cd shopizer - [ ] mvn clean install which will throws below error > [ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.233 s  FAILURE! - in com.salesmanager.test.catalog.ProductTest [ERROR] testCreateProduct Time elapsed: 0.231 s  FAILURE! java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<6> but was:<3> at com.salesmanager.test.catalog.ProductTest.testAttributes(ProductTest.java:516) at com.salesmanager.test.catalog.ProductTest.testCreateProduct(ProductTest.java:338)
patched_file_types: test-file

title: Incompatible Jackson version in default configuration
description: On a clean `git clone` and `./mvnw clean install`, install fails with exceptions related to a Jackson class missing:  Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/fasterxml/jackson/core/util/JacksonFeature Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.fasterxml.jackson.core.util.JacksonFeature  This appears to be due to an outdated Jackson version. Upgrading to `2.14.2` fixes the issue for me:  - <jackson-version>2.10.2</jackson-version> + <jackson-version>2.14.0</jackson-version>
patched_file_types: config-file
text_for_topic_modeling: Incompatible Jackson version in default configuration On a clean `git clone` and `./mvnw clean install`, install fails with exceptions related to a Jackson class missing:  Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/fasterxml/jackson/core/util/JacksonFeature Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.fasterxml.jackson.core.util.JacksonFeature  This appears to be due to an outdated Jackson version. Upgrading to `2.14.2` fixes the issue for me:  - <jackson-version>2.10.2</jackson-version> + <jackson-version>2.14.0</jackson-version> config-file
